item.title: Zurich-Style Meat Saute
item.description: Originally called “Z√ºri Gschn√§tzlets” (Zurich chopped) from the city of Zurich in Switzerland, this is a tasty and practical recipe from simple ingredients. You can use any kind of meat really, depending on your taste. Very traditionally, finely sliced liver and kidney is also mixed in with the meat and mushrooms. ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 15 min üç≥ Cook time: 15 min üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 4 Ingredients 600g Beef, finely sliced 250g Mushrooms, finely sliced 1 Onion 1 tbsp Flour 200ml White whine 200ml Cream 1 tbsp chopped parsley Directions Fry the meat in butter at high heat until it starts loosing liquid.

item.title: Spicy Sausage Pasta
item.description: A delicious spicy pasta dish, super easy to make. I’m a student and it’s relatively cheap for how much food you get. I found it in a newspaper a while back and thought I’d share it with you guys because it’s my favourite meal. I also like to drink the excess red wine while cooking which adds to the enjoyment of cooking. ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 10 min üç≥ Cook time: 50 min üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 4 Ingredients 2 red onions, chopped Olive oil 6 spicy Italian sausages 1 sprig rosemary, needles finely chopped 1 red chilli, deseeded and diced A large glass of red wine (approx.
